name: Fight Colorectal Cancer
mission: Learn what colorectal cancer is, how it develops, and the key facts, symptoms, and screening guidelines to know.
theoryOfChange: Fight Colorectal Cancer has a published 'Path to a Cure' which serves as their visionary roadmap for the future of colorectal cancer research and the engine of their research advocacy and strategic planning. This framework outlines goals, priorities, and evidence to guide improvements in colorectal cancer prevention, detection, treatment, and survivorship. The 'Path to a Cure' report is structured into four pillars, each providing progress indicators, key messages, opportunities, challenges, and the voice of survivors. Additionally, the Colorectal Cancer Care Initiative (CRCCI) and its associated report establish clear, actionable goals for colorectal cancer screening and care, serving as a tool for healthcare systems to measure progress, allocate resources, and improve outcomes. The CRCCI outlines two key goals with specific targets for timely screening, accurate diagnosis, and timely treatment initiation.
zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://fightcolorectalcancer.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

score_details.score_summary: Fight Colorectal Cancer shows strong impact and good alignment.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://fightcolorectalcancer.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization holds 12.0 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.07 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,060,301 and a program expense ratio of 85.2%.
Audited financials confirm the organization's revenue and expense structures.
The 2023 audited financials support the reported program expense ratio of 85.2%.
The organization offers various general donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid overall score due to its high financial efficiency and strong impact in the global health sector, though its alignment score is moderate due to a low specific fit for traditional Muslim donor priorities.
areas_for_improvement: Limited alignment with specific Muslim donor preferences or specialized giving frameworks.
Focus is primarily on capacity building and advocacy rather than direct clinical service delivery.

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the cause of colorectal cancer represents a significant global health urgency, the alignment for Muslim donors is considered low as there are no specific programs tailored to this community [8]. As a sadaqah-eligible organization, it provides a transparent pathway for general charitable giving toward medical advocacy and research [2][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high effectiveness in capacity building, utilizing 85.2% of its $3,060,301 revenue for programs including patient education and public awareness [2][4]. Its financial health is robust, maintaining 12.0 months of working capital and a highly efficient fundraising model of $0.07 per $1 raised [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Fight Colorectal Cancer empowers a global community of survivors and advocates to advance colorectal cancer research, policy, and patient education.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.2%, demonstrating a strong commitment to direct mission-related activities.
Excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.07 to raise every $1.
Strong liquidity with 12.0 months of working capital available to sustain operations.
baseline_narrative.summary: Fight Colorectal Cancer is a national advocacy organization dedicated to supporting patients and champions through robust public policy initiatives and medical research funding [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,060,301 and maintains a high program expense ratio of 85.2%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support its core mission [2][4].

all_citations.quote: Working Capital: 12.0 months of working capital

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid overall score due to its high financial efficiency and strong impact in the global health sector, though its alignment score is moderate due to a low specific fit for traditional Muslim donor priorities.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization lacks published beneficiary counts, making it difficult to assess cost-per-beneficiary metrics for its advocacy and education programs.
As a general health advocacy organization, it has limited alignment with specific Muslim donor preferences and is classified as sadaqah-eligible only.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: Advocacy and policy work often have systemic, long-term impacts that are difficult to quantify on a per-beneficiary basis but can affect millions of patients.
risk_factors: Lack of direct clinical service delivery
Missing beneficiary data for cost-effectiveness analysis
case_against.summary: The primary limitation for donors seeking direct impact is the organization's focus on advocacy and capacity building rather than direct clinical care.

data_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator
confidence.notes: Strong financial transparency with audited statements and BBB accreditation, though lacking specific beneficiary impact metrics.

known_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator

alignment.explanation: The organization operates in the global health and advocacy space, making it a strong choice for general charitable giving (sadaqah), though it lacks specific frameworks tailored to Muslim donors.
alignment.improvement: Add a dedicated page or clearly state whether donations align with specific Islamic giving principles to better guide Muslim donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this organization due to its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, the fact that it <cite id="4">meets all 20 BBB standards</cite>, and its publication of <cite id="9">audited financial statements</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could publish detailed impact reports outlining the specific policy outcomes achieved through its advocacy efforts.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a highly efficient financial model, featuring an <cite id="2">85.2% program expense ratio</cite> and exceptional fundraising efficiency of <cite id="3">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but missing cost-per-beneficiary data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Provides targeted grants to support allied coalitions and research initiatives.

rich_narrative.headline: Fight Colorectal Cancer empowers a global community of survivors and advocates to advance colorectal cancer research, policy, and patient education.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who are passionate about systemic change in cancer care and want to support policy advocacy, research funding, and patient education through general charitable giving (sadaqah).
donor_motivations: Desire to fund systemic policy changes and medical research
Value highly efficient organizations with low fundraising costs
Prefer supporting established advocacy networks in the US
giving_considerations: Donations support advocacy and capacity building, not direct medical treatments
Impact is measured in policy changes and research advancements rather than individual patients treated
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund direct clinical care, individual patient medical bills, or those looking for specific Islamic giving frameworks.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that while the organization has verified outcomes and a strong theory of change, it lacks the detailed beneficiary data required for rigorous cost-effectiveness analysis.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization empowers patients and champions to push for better policies and supports research and education to improve colorectal cancer outcomes.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In advocacy, evidence of impact ensures that policy efforts are translating into tangible improvements in research funding and patient care standards.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a strong 10.9% revenue CAGR and efficient operations, the organization has the capacity to scale its advocacy and research funding initiatives.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Outperforms peers with an <cite id="2">85.2% program expense ratio</cite> compared to the <cite id="7">77.5% median</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar advocacy focus but tailored to Muslim civil rights
similar_organizations.name: Muslim Public Affairs Council Foundation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on legal advocacy rather than health policy
similar_organizations.name: Muslim Legal Fund of America

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger organization focused broadly on cancer immunology research
similar_organizations.name: Cancer Research Institute

strengths.detail: The organization directs a significant portion of its budget to its core mission, maintaining an <cite id="2">85.2% program expense ratio</cite>.
Development operations are highly cost-effective, requiring only <cite id="3">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite>.
The charity maintains robust reserves, holding <cite id="5">12.0 months of working capital</cite> to ensure program continuity.

strengths_deep_dive: Fight Colorectal Cancer exhibits exceptional financial health and operational efficiency. The organization's <cite id="2">85.2% program expense ratio</cite> significantly outperforms the <cite id="7">77.5% median program ratio</cite> of its peer group in the advocacy sector. This efficiency is further highlighted by its low fundraising costs of <cite id="3">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>. Additionally, the organization has demonstrated consistent growth, achieving a <cite id="8">10.9% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. Governance is equally strong, as the charity <cite id="4">meets all 20 standards</cite> set by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance and undergoes <cite id="9">independent financial audits</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Fight Colorectal Cancer is a national advocacy organization dedicated to supporting patients and champions through robust public policy initiatives and medical research funding. The organization operates with a strong financial foundation, reporting <cite id="1">$3,060,301 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. It demonstrates a high commitment to its mission with an <cite id="2">85.2% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of its funding directly supports advocacy, research, and patient education. Furthermore, the organization is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending just <cite id="3">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. Fight Colorectal Cancer holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and <cite id="4">meets all 20 standards</cite> of the BBB Wise Giving Alliance, signaling strong governance and accountability. The organization also maintains excellent liquidity, with <cite id="5">12.0 months of working capital</cite> available to sustain operations during economic fluctuations. While it focuses primarily on capacity building and advocacy rather than direct clinical service delivery, its strategic investments include <cite id="6">$27,600 in total grants</cite> to further its mission.
